ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] heritrix embed issue
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, ... I don t have bin/setclasspath.sh, I m using TC on windows for developement. I put all heritrix libs in shared/lib or common/lib and I have the same

From: "Laurian Gridinoc" <laurian@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] heritrix embed issue
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=189012361; y=WrHihhVtBtWFDZYszp0cEHTYpKbITPPJ-gJXuYOY9DMrRr-EPmef6VfE
X-Yahoo-Profile: lauriangridinoc

Hello,

On 14/09/06, shifra.raffel@... <shifra.raffel@...> wrote:
>  >I embedded heritrix in tomcat, profile edit, job creation works, but
>  >it does not resolve the seed:
>  >"Heritrix(-1)-Domain unresolvable Seed has not been processed"
>  >I have nothing on the logs.
>  >Runned standalone it works.
>
>  I'm sure others will have some insight, but my first thought is that you
>  could be getting DNS trouble if you haven't explicitly set the Heritrix
>  jar at the front of your classpath. See last item on this page,
>  "Potential classpath issue"
>  http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?EmbeddingHeritrix -- I find I
>  have to edit Tomcat's bin/setclasspath.sh, and that once I've edited
>  that, the default classpath goes all to pieces and I have to add every
>  jar that Tomcat would ordinarily recognize on its own. Let us know if
>  that cures the problem.

I don't have bin/setclasspath.sh, I'm using TC on windows for developement.
I put all heritrix libs in shared/lib or common/lib and I have the same issue.

>  Incidentally, which version are you using?

1.10.0, but I also tried with heritrix-1.9.0-200609081500 (which I
think is almost the same)

I found this in logs, odd:

Exception in thread "StartNextJob" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:
org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpState.setCookiesMap(Ljava/util/SortedMap;)V
	at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.configureHttpCookies(FetchHTTP.java:1169)
	at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.configureHttp(FetchHTTP.java:1126)
	at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.initialTasks(FetchHTTP.java:1043)
	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.runProcessorInitialTasks(CrawlController.java:1661)
	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.requestCrawlStart(CrawlController.java:1002)
	at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJobHandler.java:1136)
	at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler$3.run(CrawlJobHandler.java:1113)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

I really dont't find the method in the http-client 3.0.1, I wonder why
it works standalone.

Thanks,
-- 
Laurian Gridinoc, purl.org/net/laur
